titleStmt.title: The Quakers quibbles in three parts : first set forth in an expostulatory epistle to Will. Pfnn [i.e. Penn] concerning the late meeting held to Barbycan between the Baptists and the Quakers, also the pretended prophet Lod. Muggleton and the Quakers compared : the second part, in reply to a quibbling answer to G. Whiteheads, entituled The Quakers plainness ... : the third part, being a continuation of their quibbles ... / by the same indifferent pen.
titleStmt.author: Thompson, Thomas.
Hedworth, Henry.
Penn, William, 1644-1718.

notesStmt.note: Each part has special t.p., and first part has 1674 imprint.
Epistle to William Penn signed: Thomas Thompson.
"H. Hedworth is also suspected of being the author of 'The Quakers Quibbles'"--Smith, J. Bibliotheca anti-Quakeriana, London, 1873.
Errata: p. [10] before pt. 2, p. [1] at end.
